articles.title: Italy Says Face Masks Won’t Be Mandatory From June 28 - CHANNELS TELEVISION
articles.description: Face masks will no longer be compulsory in Italy, one of the countries in Europe worst hit by the coronavirus, from June 28, the health ministry said Monday.
articles.content: File photo: Homemade protective face masks are prepared by Sarah, a 45-year-old volunteer, who sews face masks to be distributed to people in need, at her home in Vincennes, eastern suburbs of Paris,… [+1647 chars]

articles.author: Svar Nanan-Sen
articles.title: 'We've been sailed down the river!' UK farmers' Brexit fury as industry 'thrown under bus' - Express
articles.description: BRITISH farmers have furiously lambasted Brexit and claimed their industry has been 'sailed down the river' following the UK's exit from the European Union.

articles.author: Andrew Higgins
articles.title: Populist Leaders in Eastern Europe Run Into a Little Problem: Unpopularity - The New York Times
articles.description: The leaders of Slovenia, Hungary and Poland, who rode to power on waves of anti-elitism anger, face rising opposition over their pandemic responses and heavy-handed policies.
articles.content:
